gang,
I recently bought a rusty tsuba.............

dimension....3 inches x 3 1/4 inches
thickness..... a touch more than 3 mm, but less than 4mm
there is a " groove around the rim with traces of lacquer so i 
assumed a metal band was there but now missing.

looking at the dragon, at 2 O'clock, I think the forearm is missing, 
so the construction of the brass dragon could be " layered " ?
At 11 O'clock, only 2 claws are visible so something is missing there 
too.

questions..............
1. in rust removal using ivory, should i work around the traces of 
lacquer leaving those intact ?
2.  any opinion as to school/time period ?
I am guessing....
 a.  Heianjo  ( on a good day )?
b.  Jingo works ( on a very very good day )?
c. The all purpose Shoami ( no weather report here ) ??
d.  18th century or earlier ?

Thank you all in advance...........
